mdRecord.dcterms:description: This photograph shows students on an outdoor staircase: 32 are seated, 6 are standing. Instructors, identified on the back, are standing at lower right and at upper left. The back of the photograph lists all the students and the teacher (Mrs. Launaetta Gilmore) and instructor (M. Leroy Richardson). At the top the group is idenfied as "7th Grade First Aid Class, 1944 April." An attached handwritten note transcribes the information from the back of the photograph with the additional information that the location was Lylburn Downing School.
mdRecord.dcterms:title: First Aid Class, 7th Grade at Lylburn Downing School (photograph)
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Lylburn Downing School (Lexington, Va.)
First aid in illness and injury -- Study and teaching
African Americans -- Education
